授業目的: This course is designed to overview the major topics in the study of the Japanese language: phonetics, phonology, morphology, syntax, sociolinguistics, history, dialects, and the writing system. Various linguistic phenomena in the language will be introduced from the descriptive and comparative point of view. At the same time, theoretical concepts will also be introduced to explain typological characteristics of the language so that students will develop analytical skills in examining various linguistic problems. This course may help students deepen and widen the metalinguistic knowledge on the language.
到達目標: Students are expected to understand the various rules functioning in the Japanese grammar in terms of phonetics, phonology, semantics and syntax. One of the learning goals is to become aware of the linguistic characteristics of the Japanese language by comparing its rules with English counterparts.
授業方法: Face to face format. Lecture: Learning materials will be given to you each time you attend the class. No need to buy textbook (It's expensive). If you wish to use one, let me know by e-mail. You can borrow it. But the learning materials provided based on PowerPoint will suffice to study JL in this course. If you wish to take this class remotely for some valid reason, you can do so. You need to contact the instructor.
